Hero.title: Reboot your career
Hero.web: for web developers in the format of a bootcamp:
Hero.junior: From zero-level to Junior in three months,

ForWho.span7: to quickly find your first job as a
ForWho.text1: Ready to study five days a week from 12.00 to 19.00, plow like a galley slave,
ForWho.text2: in order to master in three months a program
ForWho.text3: , that others master in a year and a half

SchoolComparison.title: School
SchoolComparison.subtitle: Comparison
SchoolComparison.description: We have prepared a detailed comparison table for you, where all major programming schools are presented in comparison with ours.

description.item1: Every day you go to the bootcamp. The atmosphere and live communication help to focus and keep you motivated.
description.item2: Together with an offline group, but via Discord. Unlike online schools, you immediately get answers to all questions.
description.item3: Partly online, partly at the bootcamp. When you want to chat live, but are not ready to pay offline.
description.item4: You are away from home, but you want to study live - in a close cultural environment, with teachers from Russia.

QuestionsRemain.title: Is it difficult? Let's explain!
QuestionsRemain.subtitle: Leave a request - we will contact you via messenger.

conditions.text: By clicking on the "Submit Application" button, you accept
conditions.link: terms for the transfer of information

ScheduleCard.text1: With a mentor. New theory, collaborative problem solving, checking homework
ScheduleCard.text3: With a mentor. Consolidation of material, analysis of difficult moments

Header.btn: I'd like to talk, call me

SchoolInfo.title: About School
SchoolInfo.project: How did we create the project?
SchoolInfo.problem: What problems do await the newcomer?
SchoolInfo.web: How and why do we teach programming?

SchoolItemsProject.item1: At the heart of our project is the program of American bootcamps: they have existed for 10 years and a high percentage of their graduates find work.
SchoolItemsProject.item2: We showed the resulting training program to friends who work in large Russian and foreign IT companies to understand how it meets the requirements of their companies.
SchoolItemsProject.item3: We found like-minded people with extensive programming experience who tired of just writing code, they wanted to communicate with people more - they ripe for teaching. It turned out that their pedagogical skills often not enough, despite the fact that they have already trained interns in their companies or taught friends to code. We taught them how to teach professionally.
SchoolItemsProject.item4: Our team is from St. Petersburg, if you know what that means) St. Petersburg is like a metaphor for the cultural capital, a place for nerds and human connection.

FaqInfo.title: Frequently asked Questions
FaqInfo.ask: Didn't you find an answer? Ask a Question
FaqInfo.requirements: What kind of computer and operating system do you need?
FaqInfo.todo: What do you need to do before starting bootcamp training?
FaqInfo.payment: How can I pay for tuition?

FaqRequirements.keyOne: Any laptop will do, as long as it's fast. If it slows down, it's better to install Linux Ubuntu 20.04 LTS.
FaqRequirements.keyTwo: It is preferable to have a Linux or MacOS operating system to get used to working with the command line.

FaqTodo.keyOne: Talk to family and friends so that they do not distract you during the training. All cases after 3-4 months. It is important.
FaqTodo.keyTwo: Complete our preparatory program. You will practice the most difficult part for beginners, which means you will get more from the course. And also you will understand for yourself whether programming as a new profession suits you.
FaqTodo.keyThree: Set aside money for five months. You will study for three months and then, on average, look for a job for two months (respond to vacancies, solve test tasks, work out the mistakes that you made in interviews).
FaqTodo.keyFour: Tune in to plow) Rest awaits you in a couple of years.

FaqToPay.keyTwo: There is a loan (installment plan) up to 2 years from Tinkoff Bank.

SchoolBegginer.header: So you decided to become a programmer. As a rule, you go to watch YouTube, read articles and maybe consult a friend. As soon as the first information entered your head, you realized that programming is too abstract. We need to define a bunch of new variables.
SchoolBegginer.item1: What industry do I want to work in?
SchoolBegginer.item2: How much time does it take to master?
SchoolBegginer.item3: How to study: on your own or go to school?
SchoolBegginer.item4: What is the best programming language for a beginner?
SchoolBegginer.item5: What technologies do you need to master in order to be hired for your first job?
SchoolBegginer.item6: What is the best school to study at? How are they really different? And which one is right for me?
SchoolBegginer.item7: When is it time to finish studying and have to spend most of the time looking for a job?
SchoolBegginer.item8: Why do employers ignore 95% of my applications? How to fix it?
SchoolBegginer.item9: Which companies are good for professional growth?
SchoolBegginer.item10: How do not to commit suicide when you read the job description of joon?
SchoolBegginer.paragraph1: Graduates from other schools often come to us because they could not find a job. They seem to already know something, but this is not enough to find a job.
SchoolBegginer.paragraph2: Sometimes you just need to clear your mind. Clearly prioritize and recognize your strengths.
SchoolBegginer.paragraph3: We are happy to help such guys, as we ourselves went through this hell)

SchoolItemStuding.header: We do not try to cram as many facts about programming into you as possible - this is a road to depression, confirmed by our experience) We help you learn to think like an engineer.
SchoolItemStuding.item1: What questions do you need to answer before you take on the task.
SchoolItemStuding.item2: How to draw a flowchart so as not to get confused.
SchoolItemStuding.item3: How to highlight the main thing in the task.
SchoolItemStuding.item4: How much time should be allocated to a task.
SchoolItemStuding.item5: What do you need to figure out on your own, and when is it time to ask the elders.
SchoolItemStuding.item6: How to formulate questions so that colleagues understand you.
